channel.title: Projects on My Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on My Portfolio

item.title: DnaSequenceAlignment
item.description: A C++ program developed in Com S 229 (advanced programming techniques) for determing the optimal alignment for various DNA sequences by utilizing dynamic programming.

item.title: PencilMotion
item.description: A C++/OpenGL graphical application that calculates and renders the motion of a pencil tumbling through the air, and bouncing off a surface.

item.title: WumpusWorld
item.description: A SE 329 group project. A graphics-based game built in Java/OpenGL to demonstrate the Wumpus World game, a popular game to study in AI courses. Phase 2 of the project consisted of a networking component to play against friends, and AI components so users could challenge an AI player.

item.title: WikiClicki
item.description: A SE329 (project management) group project in which we developed a web-based game made in JavaScript and HTML, utilizing D3 graphing utilities.

item.title: OrangesToOranges
item.description: A semester long group project, in which we developed an Android game based off of the popular card game Apples-to-Apples. Users could start games to play with other friends who also had the app, and create/use custom made cards and decks.

item.title: FaceMapper
item.description:
SE 329 group project.

The goal was to develop an application to automate attendance taking in classrooms. After being fed training images for the faces of students in a class, it attempts to identify those individuals in class photos and take attendance accordingly. View Source
